intro: Cucubalus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine cucumber, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has slender, trailing vines that can grow up to several meters in length. Its fruits are typically small, green, and somewhat resemble cucumbers in appearance. The species is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
